item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks, Recreation and Public Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Resources.

summary.text: Amends the Virgin River Dinosaur Footprint Preserve Act to allow a grant disbursed by the Secretary of the Interior to the City of St. George, Utah, to be used for one or more of the following purposes related to the Virgin River Dinosaur Footprint Preserve: (1) purchase of the property; (2) educational outreach; (3) construction of buildings for the protection and preservation of paleontological resources; and (4) preservation and exploration of paleontological resources and their preparation for display. (Current law permits the grant to be used only for purchase of the property.)

bill.title: To amend the Virgin River Dinosaur Footprint Preserve Act to allow funds available under that Act to be used for preservation, exploration, and preparation of paleontological resources for display, educational outreach, and related construction.

item.title: To amend the Virgin River Dinosaur Footprint Preserve Act to allow funds available under that Act to be used for preservation, exploration, and preparation of paleontological resources for display, educational outreach, and related construction.

To amend the Virgin River Dinosaur Footprint Preserve Act to allow funds available under that Act to be used for preservation, exploration, and preparation of paleontological resources for display, educational outreach, and related construction.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
